META.prose: Here's a look at the process of family reunifications according to data released in the July 26th federal court case filing
META.note: These include reunifications with parents in the interior, discharges to other sponsors (such as in situations where the parent is not eligible for reunification), reunifications with parents in DHS custody earlier in the process or children that turned 18

DATA.desc: Total number of possible children originally identified
Total number of children who have been discharged from custody
Children discharged by being reunified with parents in ICE custody
Children whom further review showed were not separated from parents
Children in government care, where the adult associated with the child is either not eligible for reunification or not available for discharge at this time
Children whose parents were likely deported
Children whose reunification was precluded by plaintiffs and court order
Children whose parents triggered red flags in background check
Children whose parents triggered red flags from another case file review
Children whose parents were released into the interior
Children whose parents' location is under case file review
